title: Micro Adventurer magazine (& book) complete OCR'd PDFs
description:
Micro Adventurer Magazine Issues 01-17 (November 1983 - March 1995)
  and Spectrum Adventurer (book)
  
Micro Adventurer was published by Sunshine Books, and as the name
suggests was devoted to the burgeoning field of "adventure games" -
typically text-based interactive games that focussed on puzzle-solving
rather than any kind of reflex reaction. Micro Adventurer was platform
agnostic, and was successful for 17 issues before being unceremoniously
canned without warning. Also included in this collection is the book
"Spectrum Adventures" by the same publisher.

These PDFs are the compiled collections of page scans available on the
Internet. They've been OCR'd to allow text searching and copying - this
should prove very useful for the adventure archivist who'd like to have
their own local searchable archive. They look great on most PDF readers,
including most capable mobile devices.

In keeping with the subject matter, Micro Adventurer had a fairly fixed
and plain page layout, meaning the OCR process should be fairly
accurate. However, as always it's a "best effort", and some of the more
whacky layouts and fonts used will give mixed results.

More OCR'd scans will be periodically available - please Google RetroPDFs 
for more information.

Thanks to Martijn van der Heide for the wonderful World Of Spectrum site
(www.worldofspectrum.org), and all the visitors and donators to
RetroPDFs for their support.

90's style "greets" to anyone formally or currently involved in the
Amiga scene, especially Pazza, Mic Flair, Violator, Denzil, Tango, Fat
Will, Torch, mUb and Maximan, and anyone else who read or wrote for LSD
Grapevine. Nostalgia ain't what it used to be ;)

Ken D 

(Google 'RetroPDFs')
